title: Base animation speed
description: All animations within the system base their speed on this value. Smaller values (in seconds) make for faster animations

title: Avatar background color
description: The basic background of all avatars, graphical and generic

title: Avatar border radius
description: Controls the size of the rounded corners on avatars - a sufficiently large value will make avatars circular

title: Dynamic avatar font
description: For letter-based avatars, this is the font employed for the text

title: Dynamic avatar base line height
description: Use this to help vertically center a dynamic avatar character when changing the font. This will be scaled based on the font size percentage.

title: Dynamic avatar text size (%)
description: Using a value between 0 and 100, this represents the approximate height of a dynamic avatar text character as a percentage of avatar.

title: Badge
description: Badges appear to indicate a number if items requiring attention, such as unread messages in your inbox

title: Badge - highlighted
description: Highlighted badges grab the viewer's attention more and tend to indicate new items to be reviewed

title: BB code blocks
description: All BB code blocks within messages make use of these styling rules

title: Maximum expandable BB code block height
description: When a large quote is posted in a message, it will expand to this height before a scrollbar appears

title: BB code blocks - title
description: Styles the title section of BB code blocks within messages

title: BB code block - inline code
description: Special styling rules for inline code ([ICODE]) elements.

title: Block border framework
description: Virtually all blocks have their borders styled with these settings

title: Block border radius
description: Controls the size of the curve on block border corners

title: Block filter bar
description: When the content of a block can be filtered, the controls to do so are styled here

title: Block footer
description: When information needs to be conveyed in a footer element for a block, its style is controlled here

title: Block header
description: Blocks often have title bars at their tops, which are styled here

title: Block link
description: Some links are displayed as small blocks such as choices in a popup menu, and their background will highlight when hovered

title: Block link - selected
description: Styling for block-type links when in their selected state

title: Block minor header
description: Sub-headings in blocks use these settings

title: Block minor tab header
description: Used for multi-part, tabbed sub-headings

title: Block minor tab header - selected tab
description: Selected tabs from block sub-headings

title: Block padding horizontal
description: The horizontal space between the edges of a block and its content

title: Block padding vertical
description: The vertical space between a block's content and its edges

title: Block tab header
description: Occasionally, blocks will have multi-part, tab headers, styled with these settings

title: Block tab header - selected tab
description: The selected tab in multi-part headers takes additional styling from here

title: Block text header
description: Text headers are used for subtle identification of content areas, without changing the background style or color

title: Border color
description: Structural borders around blocks of content generally use this color

title: Button base
description: Defines the styling for the basic elements that are common to all text-based buttons

title: Button - call to action
description: Call to action buttons sit alone and invite the user to do something, like post a new thread

title: Button - default
description: Most buttons use this styling, except for primary form submit buttons

title: Button - disabled
description: When buttons are disabled and unclickable, they use these styling rules

title: Button - primary
description: These rules are used mostly for the main submit button for forms

title: Chips
description: The primary use for chips is in tagging content, where each tag will appear as a chip

title: Chips - hovered
description: Chip styling is adjusted using these settings when they are hovered

title: Accented content area base
description: When attention needs to be directed to content, this background may be employed

title: Accented content background color
description: This background color is used for further differentiation from regular content

title: Accented content area links
description: Links within accented content will be styled with these settings

title: Alternate content area base
description: When an alternative background needs to be presented along side the main content background, this will be employed

title: Alternate content background color
description: In order to differentiate it, some content will be presented on this alternative background

title: Content area base
description: This styling is applied to the background of primary content, such as messages

title: Content background color
description: Most normal content will sit on this background

title: Highlighted content area base
description: If an area of content is selected, for example a row in a table, its normal background will be substituted with this

title: Highlighted content background color
description: When the standard background color is highlighted or selected, it will use this color

title: Data list footer
description: When data lists have a terminating element at their foot, it is styled here

title: Data list header
description: The title bar of a data list is styled with these settings

title: Data list padding horizontal
description: Each row in a data list has this much horizontal padding

title: Data list padding vertical
description: Data list rows each have this much vertical padding

title: Data list section header
description: Individual data list sections are divided with this titular header bar

title: Editor selected text background color
description: Background color for text that has been selected in the editor

title: Editor selected text color
description: When text is selected within the text editor, it will use this color

title: Editor toolbar active color
description: When controls on the editor toolbar are active (such as 'B' when bold text is selected), the control will use this color

title: Editor toolbar background color
description: Controls the color of the control bar's background for the text editor

title: Editor toolbar border color
description: Like popup menus, the editor has an upper border accent, controlled here

title: Element spacer
description: This represents the base value for spacing between elements, such as individual blocks.

title: Email background color
description: Emails sent in HTML format will have this as its background color

title: Email font
description: Defines the font (or font list) used for text in HTML emails

title: Email header text color
description: Defines the color of text in the header bar in HTML email

title: Fixed message bar
description: Occasionally, system messages will be displayed to the visitor in a fixed element that slides down from the top of the window. Its styling is controlled here

title: Body Text Font
description: This font is used for the text of messages etc.
property_value: 'Segoe UI', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', sans-serif

title: Code Font
description: The font list used for mono-spaced text input and output
property_value: Monaco, Menlo, Consolas, 'Roboto Mono', 'Andale Mono', 'Ubuntu Mono', monospace

title: User Interface Font
description: The font list for your main text
property_value: 'Segoe UI', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', sans-serif

title: Form element explanation text
description: Additional information about form controls may sometimes be found immediately below the control being explained

title: Form element hint text
description: Within the label column, some controls may require an additional hint to define their role

title: Form label column
description: In full-width forms, the left column contains labels for the controls in the right column

title: Form label column width
description: This should be expressed as a percentage.

title: Form row responsive break point
description: When the viewport width is below this value, the two-column layout will collapse into a single column version

title: Form row horizontal padding (inner)
description: This horizontal padding is applied to the touching edges of the label and controls columns

title: Form row horizontal padding (outer)
description: This padding is applied to the outer edges of the form content

title: Form row vertical padding
description: Each form row has this padding above and below its content

title: Form section header
description: Occasionally, forms are long enough to warrant being divided into sections, with each section headed by an element using these style rules

title: Form submit row
description: At the bottom of most forms is a bar containing the submit button etc.

title: Enable sticky form submit rows
description: If selected, longer forms may attach their submit rows to the bottom of the window when they wouldn't otherwise be visible.

title: Global action indicator color
description: This is the base color of the gadgets that display when an action is being processed in the background.

title: Inline moderation bar
description: A bar containing controls appears when content is selected for inline moderation. Its appearance is controlled here

title: Inline moderation highlight color
description: When content is selected for inline moderation, its background color will be replaced with this

title: Form input
description: Controls the style of most text-input boxes

title: Form input - disabled
description: When text boxes are disabled, these rules are applied

title: Form input - focused
description: These rules are applied to text boxes when they are selected for input

title: Line height
description: This value controls the amount of spacing between lines of text

title: Links
description: These are the styling rules for basic hyperlinks throughout the system

title: Link color
description: Basic hyperlinks on standard background colors will use this style

title: Links - hovered
description: When basic links are hovered, they use this set of rules for their styling

title: Link hover color
description: Basic hyperlinks will turn this color when hovered

title: Member profile header
description: The member profile page's content header is styled with these settings

title: Member profile header - name
description: The styling of the name of the member whose page is being viewed is controlled here

title: Member tooltip header
description: The member tooltip, which appears when hovering over user names, is styled with these controls

title: Member tooltip header - name
description: Styling for the name of the user whose tooltip is being displayed

title: Menu
description: Controls the main block of all popup menus

title: Menu feature border color
description: Popup menus have a thick feature border on their upper edge, the styling of which is controlled here

title: Menu footer
description: When a popup menu has a bottom, footer element, it will use these settings

title: Menu header
description: Most menus identify themselves with a header just underneath their top border

title: Menu tab header
description: Multi-part, tabbed menu headers use these settings

title: Menu tab header - selected tab
description: Controls the selected tab in multi-part menu headers

title: New message indicator
description: Usually a small token attached to the message block, the indicator that a message is new/unread is controlled here

title: Message padding
description: When using the full-size message block, this value defines the size of the padding around the message text

title: Message padding small
description: This value controls the padding around the message text when using the small message block

title: Message signature
description: Any rules used to apply styling to users' signatures in their messages are defined here

title: Message single column break point
description: When the viewport is smaller than this value, the user column will collapse, leaving a single-column message layout

title: Message user info block
description: Apart from its width, the (left) message user info column is styled here

title: Message user info block width
description: Controls the width of the (left) user info column on the full size message block

title: Message user info elements
description: The elements selected here will be displayed in the message user info block. It will not be displayed below the single column width.

title: Minor internal block content
description: Content within blocks that is of less importance than the main content may be styled here

title: Read node icon color
description: When the content within a node has been read, its icon will revert to a less attention-grabbing color, defined here

title: Unread node icon color
description: Node icons give an at-a-glance indication of whether or not the content housed within the node has been read. The unread icon color should stand out from its background for quick identification

title: Description display style
description: To save vertical space, it is possible to hide node descriptions until the node title is hovered, at which point they are displayed in a tooltip

title: Sub-forums display style
description: Choose the style in which sub-forums will be displayed within a particular node element, according to the amount of space you want them to occupy

title: Scrollable notice interval
description: Each scrollable notice will be displayed for this amount of time before the next is displayed. Hovering or interacting with the notices will prevent auto scrolling.

title: Overlay header
description: Overlays use a header element to identify their contents, styled here

title: Overlay mask color
description: When an overlay is shown, the page behind is masked by the color defined here. Use RGBA transparency to allow the page to show through

title: Overlay top margin
description: This defines the distance between the top of the viewport and the top of the overlay

title: Page background
description: The page background, behind all block elements, uses the styling rules defined here

title: Page background color
description: The background of the page itself, on which all other content rests

title: Page edge spacer
description: All elements will be spaced at least this far from the edges of the page

title: Maximum page width
description: As the window is resized, it will continue to grow in width until this value, after which it will remain static

title: Progress bar color
description: The progress bar appears at the top of the window when the system is waiting for a response from the server

title: Favicon URL (32x32)
description: Path to the small logo that is associated with bookmarks pointing to your site

title: Footer
description: The footer is the primary element that sits below the main content on all public pages

title: Footer links
description: Controls styling for individual links within the footer

title: Header/logo row
description: The header row contains your logo and sits at the top of every public page

title: Header adjustment color
description: The color of the header background is adjusted to be used as the background for the inbox and alerts area in the header

title: Logo URL
description: The web path from your site's XenForo installation directory to your logo image.

title: 2x logo URL
description: The path to a double-resolution / retina version of your logo image

title: Metadata Logo URL
description: Path to the metadata / OpenGraph logo used by your site on social media

title: Navigation row
description: The navigation row sits below the header and contains the primary site navigation tabs and menus

title: Navigation collapse width
description: Below this page width, the navigation system will collapse down into an off canvas menu

title: Navigation padding horizontal
description: Defines the amount of padding applied horizontally to each main navigational tab in the header

title: Navigation padding vertical
description: This value defines the amount of padding applied to the main navigational tabs in the header

title: Navigation row - selected tab
description: Additional styling to apply to navigation tabs when they are selected

title: Sticky navigation element
description: If you intend for some or all of your header to stick to the top of the page when it is scrolled, choose which elements should stick

title: Navigation row - tab
description: Controls the styling of individual tab elements within the navigation row

title: Navigation row - hovered tab
description: Additional styling to apply to navigation tabs when the pointer hovers over them

title: Staff tools bar
description: Visible only to staff, the staff tools bar sits above the header and contains items such as reported content, the moderation queue...

title: Sub-navigation row
description: Below the main navigation row, this row shows content associated with the selected main navigation tab

title: Sub-navigation row - hovered element
description: Additional styling applied to sub-navigation tabs when the pointer hovers over them

title: Page edge spacer removal break point
description: When the page is narrower than this value, the spacers at the edge of the page are discarded

title: Medium responsive break point
description: Medium width styling rules are used below this page width value

title: Narrow responsive break point
description: The page is considered 'narrow' if its width is less than this value

title: Wide responsive break point
description: The page will use the 'wide' styling rules if its width is below this value, and the 'full' rules if the width exceeds it

title: Sidebar and side navigation spacer
description: Distance between the main content and the sidebar

title: Sidebar and side navigation width
description: Width of any elements that make up the sidebar

title: Standalone tabs
description: Tabs that are not part of block headers are styled here

title: Standalone tabs - selected tab
description: The selected tab in groups that are not part of block headers

title: Style type
description: This defines the general type of style in use based on whether the content is placed on a light or dark background. This may change how colors are selected in certain scenarios.

title: Text color
description: Unless otherwise specified, text will be this color

title: Dimmed text color
description: Used when less-important text is placed next to normal text

title: Muted text color
description: Text is further de-emphasised using this style

title: Tooltip
description: Certain elements have special floating tooltips, which are controlled here

title: What's new navigation style
description: This controls how the navigation is displayed in the what's new section. Side navigation works better with more sections but requires more space.

title: Z-index multipler
description: Controls the relative 'height' of elements in the Z-dimension (perpendicular to the screen). Unless you have a specific reason to change this, leave it alone...
